title: RBLDT-Based Scientific Inquiry Process for Creative Thinking and Digital Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific terminology and experience with digital device usage
context.additional_context: Learners perform team-based digital collaboration in real-time video environments, while instructors provide learning materials and feedback via online platforms.

learning_goals: Applying the RBLDT model to enhance creative thinking strategies (divergent/convergent thinking) to an executable level by over 80% of learners during scientific concept (biological organization) exploration
Accurately mastering and explaining over 70% of scientific concepts using various digital tools (online databases, collaboration platforms)
Achieving a 30%+ improvement in digital literacy assessment metrics (e.g., information retrieval, content creation, collaboration skills) compared to pre-assessment

resources: Video conferencing tools such as ZOOM/Teams
Digital collaboration boards such as Padlet/Miro
Multimedia materials related to science concepts (videos, infographics)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
